'''Broad Creek''' is an unincorporated area and [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[Carteret County, North Carolina|Carteret County]], [[North Carolina]], United States. As of the [[2010 United States Census|2010 census]] it had a population of 2,334.ref name="Census 2010"{{cite web| url=http://factfinder2.census.gov/bkmk/table/1.0/en/DEC/10_DP/G001/1600000US3708040| title=Geographic Identifiers: 2010 Demographic Profile Data (G001): Broad Creek CDP, North Carolina| publisher=U.S. Census Bureau, American Factfinder| accessdate=December 24, 2014}}</ref> It is part of the greater [[Newport, North Carolina|Newport]] area and currently shares the Newport zip code of 28570.
==Geography== Broad Creek is located in west-central Carteret County, on the north shore of [[Bogue Sound]], between the tidal inlets of [[Broad Creek (Bogue Sound)|Broad Creek]] to the west and [[Gales Creek (North Carolina)|Gales Creek]] to the east. Bogue Sound is separated from the [[Atlantic Ocean]] to the south by [[Bogue Banks]], part of North Carolina's [[barrier island]]s known as the [[Crystal Coast]]. The Broad Creek community is bordered on the north by [[Croatan National Forest]].
[[North Carolina Highway 24]] passes through the community, leading east convert12mi to [[Morehead City, North Carolina|Morehead City]] and west convert8mi0 to [[Cape Carteret, North Carolina|Cape Carteret]]. Newport is convert7mi0 to the northeast up Hibbs Road. 9 Mile Road runs north from Broad Creek, providing a direct route to [[Havelock, North Carolina|Havelock]], convert13mi to the north. Broad Creek Loop Road forms a loop through the center of the community, south of NC 24.
The Broad Creek CDP has a total area of convert8.1km2disp=flip, of which convert0.03km2disp=flip2, or 0.35%, is water.ref name="Census 2010"
Housing developments in Broad Creek include Salty Shores, Croatan Colony, Rolling Wood, Fox Lair, Bogue Pines, Whispering Pines, Karobi Park, Adams Harbor, Pearson Circle, Bar Harbor, Bluewater Banks.
